channel.title: Using Bright REST APIs on Brightsec
channel.description: Recent content in Using Bright REST APIs on Brightsec

item.title: About Bright API
item.description: To enable full automation in to your CI/CD pipeline, you can use the Bright API to fully configure your development and testing flows. More information is provided on our API documentation page. [block:image] { “images”: [ { “image”: [ “https://files.readme.io/79d0816-swagger-logo.png”, “swagger-logo.png”, 3578 ], “sizing”: “80” } ] } [/block]

item.title: Response Status Codes
item.description: The error status codes are what Bright app returns when an API request or call fails. This topic provides a table of error codes with possible causes and troubleshooting actions. [block:parameters] { “data”: { “h-0”: “Code”, “h-1”: “Description”, “h-2”: “How to fix”, “0-0”: “1005”, “0-1”: “The connection request that the client is sending to the server is being blocked by the server and the content is not being sent to the client.
